medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe occipital headaches, dysarthria, difficulty hearing, and gait difficulties.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. K presented with a 1-month history of severe occipital headaches and a 2-day history of dysarthria, hearing difficulty, and gait issues. Symptoms worsened with additional onset of diplopia and vertigo, with no improvement after initial treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of depressive symptoms at approximately age 22, but no formal psychiatric treatment sought; history of significant trauma including severe physical and emotional abuse during childhood.
medical_history.family_history: Younger sister suffered an aneurysm resulting in paralysis, aunt died of a brain aneurysm at age 30, and two grandparents died from strokes.
medical_history.social_history: Ms. K is an African American woman and a church minister who was raised in a religious environment. She has three children and has been involved in significant community outreach efforts. Ms. K reported feeling helpless after being beaten during a robbery and expressed distress over recent traumatic events concerning her daughters.
